scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-1578 Exoplanetary System


Overview

Kepler-1578 is a star with 0.9 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.86 times its radius. It is located 3470.46 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 4.27 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

Kepler-1578 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the Kepler-1578 system


Kepler-1578 b

Kepler-1578 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory, in 2016-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of Kepler-1578 b is 1.119 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-1578 b is 1.040 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, Kepler-1578 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-1578, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Kepler.
name: Kepler-1578 - System With 1 Exoplanet
